name: djmix2022
why: I was looking for a way to rebuild my blog, and also practice my React skills. I read about Frontity and decided this would be a good way to do both.
learn: I learnt about headless architecture, and how to use React with WordPress.  I also learnt about the Frontity framework, and how to use it to build a blog...and the drawbacks of it.
different: Well, I would use NextJS as it is easier to use, and actually supported - Frontity is no longer supported by the developers.  Plus NextJS has much more functionality and is more flexible.  I ended up doing some pretty hacky things to get pages/functionality that require data from all 150+ pages (eg promise.all that runs 16 times on one particular page)...plus some basic things are simply not supported like sitemaps.  It looks pretty though...in my opinion.

name: jameswinfield-blog-next-new
why: I got a bit annoyed at M&S for some reason I forget now, but realised that my portfolio was the same one as before I was ever an engineer
learn: I didn't do anything crazy for this, I just took a NextJS template and redesigned it a bit.  It was my second NextJS project, the other being a work project that was already set up, so I learnt a bit about how to set up a NextJS project from scratch.
different: Not sure I would have done much differently.  It was really good practice for the technologies we were moving to at M&S.  I realised that I wasn't a Tailwind convert as I was forever having to look up classnames which slowed me down.

name: random-recipe-generator
why: We were doing a hackathon at work, and I decided my priority was to help a junior engineer upskill on the new tech stack we were moving to.
learn: Nothing really, I was just helping someone else learn.
different: Maybe I should have been more selfish and took the opportunity to learn something myself...like Remix or Svelte for example.

name: worldofwinfield-nextjs
why: I wanted to redesign my personal blog, as it was pretty dull-looking and I'm quite colourful in real life.
learn: This was the project where I started using Github Actions for my pipeline checks, and also using Husky for pre-commit checks.
different: Not sure I would do anything differently, though I think I did rush to try to complete it...I do need to do a little cleaning up.

name: 20TwentyScore
why: This started because I thought it might be a cool little app, and perhaps something I could publish for people to use.
learn: My idea is that you could keep scores in a database, so I learnt how to hook up postgres to a NextJS app.  Granted I've mostly only done UI, but I do have the auth established, using NextAuth.  Also used it as an opportunity to practice writing unit tests, along with React Context which is something I'd used but not set-up previously.
different: Well, there's still plenty to do, but I did make my life harder by not thinking in advance about how to keep state across the different components - not entirely sure the context is split most efficiently, but it works!

name: londonlist
why: I wanted an app that would allow me to create shareable to-do lists for my active London life, and from a technical perspective to use Strapi and postgres.
learn: Well I've learnt how to use Strapi, how to set it up with dev/prod, and how to read from it.  Otherwise, mostly I've done very little on this project so far, but am using CSS Modules which is new to me.
